availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Mary Louisa Pennington Lewis in Caldwell County, Kentucky, on January 25, 1845. Father of Warren P. Lewis, William Lewis, Eugene Lewis, Frank Lewis, and Marion Lewis. Farmer in Caldwell County in 1850. Farmer in Princeton in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Caldwell County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 2, p. 389A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 42.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 220A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Mortality Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 177.
Kentucky Marriage RecordsMadison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Caldwell County Marriages, Film #000851644, p. 12.
